description:
Join us on July 7 for a four--week innovative online professional development course! This course will teach participants how to identify and implement a local service-learning campaign using the new Roots & Shoots program model. 
 
Complete the course and mentor young people to lead change in their communities by mapping needs, collaborating with stakeholders, and designing practical solutions in the form of campaigns. Connect young people to Dr. Goodall’s message of hope while facilitating a sense of empowerment that comes from helping others!Please register by logging into your Google account so that you can track course progress and take the assessments. If you don't yet have a Google account, sign up here.
Learning OutcomesThrough participation in this course students will:

Be able to identify how mapping plays a role in JGI's conservation initiatives;
Be able to define community mapping and explain the concept of place-based education;
Be able to explain how community mapping fits in to the seven elements and five phases of service learning;
Feel comfortable making a community map using Google Maps Engine Lite;
Be confident teaching their learners about community mapping, defining a community need and planning a service project to address this need; and
Feel comfortable integrating the Roots & Shoots formula into their lessons.



                                            Syllabus
                        Unit 1 - Introduction
Unit 2 - Engaging Young People
Unit 3 - Making Observations & Mapping Community
Unit 4 - Prioritizing Community Needs & Planning A Campaign
Unit 5 - Documenting Your Work
Unit 6 - Recognizing Success & Celebrating Impact
Unit 7 - Course Overview
title: Turning Learners Into Leaders: Empowering Youth Through Service in Education
